metadata.documentation: The SAGE III Ozone Loss and Validation Experiment (SOLVE) was a measurement campaign designed to examine the processes controlling ozone levels at mid- to high latitudes. Measurements were made in the Arctic high-latitude region in winter using the NASA DC-8 and ER-2 aircraft, as well as balloon platforms and ground-based instruments.

Users of these data files are expected to follow the NASA ESPO Archive guidelines for use of the SOLVE data, including consulting with the PIs of the individual measurements for interpretation and credit.
metadata.project: NASA Earth Science Project Office, Ames Research Center
